intro: Diplotaxis assurgens subsp. assurgens, commonly known as the African dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of dark green, hairy leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been cultivated for its ability to attract pollinators.
